description: wife to Aegeon, an abbess at Ephesus
name: Aemilia

description: a lady attending on Princess Katherine
name: Alice

description: lord attending on the banished Duke
name: Amiens

description: Katharine's maid of honor, afterwards Queen
name: Anne Bullen

description: twin brother of Antipholus of Syracuse, son to Aegeon and Aemilia
name: Antipholus of Ephesus

description: twin brother of Antipholus of Ephesus, son to Aegeon and Aemelia
name: Antipholus of Syracuse

description: a sea captain, friend to Sebastain
name: Antonio

description: the King's brother, the usurping Duke of Milan
name: Antonio

description: of Cnidos, a teacher of rhetoric.
name: Artemidorus

description: Duke of Bretagne, nephew to the king
name: Arthur

description: son to Cymbeline, disguised under the name of Cadwal, supposed son to Morgan
name: Arviragus

description: son of the Duke of York
name: Duke of Aumerle

description: Antonio's friend, suitor likewise to Portia
name: Bassanio

description: of the Red Rose, or Lancaster, faction
name: Basset

description: brother to Saturninus; in love with Lavinia
name: Bassianus

description: brother to Henry IV, uncle to Henry V
name: Duke of Bedford

description: a banished lord, disguised under the name of Morgan
name: Belarius

description: Nephew to Montague, and friend to Romeo
name: Benvolio

description: a gentleman attending on Lady Anne
name: Berkeley

description: of Spain, niece to King John
name: Blanch

description: lord attending on the princess of France
name: Boyet

description: a Trojan priest, taking part with the Greeks
name: Calchas

description: Ambassador from the Emperor Charles V
name: Capucius

description: Head of the house of Capulet
name: Capulet

description: An old man, cousin to Capulet
name: Second Capulet

description: ambassador from France to King John
name: Chatillon

description: son to the Queen by a former husband
name: Cloten

description: son of Priam, king of Troy
name: Deiphobus

description: Daughter to Brabantio and wife to Othello
name: Desdemona

description: twin brother to Dromio of Syracuse, and attendant on the two Antipholuses
name: Dromio of Ephesus

description: twin brother to Dromio of Ephesus, and attendant on the two Antipholuses
name: Dromio of Syracuse

description: son of the Duke of Norfolk
name: Earl of Surrey

description: duke of York, uncle to the king
name: Edmund of Langley

description: agent for Silvia in her escape
name: Eglamour

description: an ambassador from Antony to Caesar
name: Euphronius

description: uncle to Henry IV, great-uncle to Henry V
name: Duke of Exeter

description: son to the King of Naples
name: Ferdinand

description: the Duke's brother, and usurper of his dominions
name: Frederick

description: of the French forces in Bordeaux
name: General

description: Queen of Denmark and mother to Hamlet
name: Gertrude

description: son to Cymbeline, disguised under the name of Polydote, supposed son to Morgan
name: Guiderius

description: son of the former king and nephew to the present king
name: Hamlet

description: son of Priam, king of Troy
name: Hector

description: a gentlewoman protected by the Countess
name: Helena

description: son of Priam, king of Troy
name: Helenus

description: Earl of Richmond, later Henry VII
name: Richmond (Henry VII)

description: Henry Beaufort, great-uncle to Henry V, bishop of Winchster, and later cardinal
name: Winchester

description: daughter to Egeus, in love with Lysander
name: Hermia

description: queen of the Amazons, betrothed to Theseus
name: Hippolyta

description: daughter to Cymbeline by a former queen
name: Imogen

description: the Duke's brother, and usurper of his dominions
name: Jaques (lord)

description: the Duke's brother, and usurper of his dominions
name: Jaques (son)

description: duke of Lancaster, uncle to the king
name: John of Gaunt

description: widow of Edward Prince of Wales, son to King Henry VI; afterwards married to Richard III
name: Lady Anne

description: son to Vincentio, in love with Bianca
name: Lucentio

description: tribune of the people, and brother to Titus
name: Marcus Andronicus

description: daughter to Reignier, afterwards married to King Henry VI
name: Queen Margaret

description: neighbor and friend to the widow
name: Mariana

description: lord attending on the princess of France
name: Mercade

description: Kinsman to Escalus the prince, and friend to Romeo

description: Head of the house of Montague
name: Montague

description: Othello's predecessor in the government of Cyprus

description: soldiers of Achilles in the Trojan war

description: sister to Caesar and wife to Antony

description: son of Sir Rowland de Boys

name: Orlando

description: A noble Moor in the service of the Ventian state
name: Othello

name: Paris

description: son of Priam, king of Troy
name: Paris

description: a gentleman of Verona, a suitor to Katherina
name: Petruchio

name: Philip the Bastard

description: master of the revels to Theseus
name: Philostrate

description: starts as Lady Grey, marries Edward IV
name: Queen Elizabeth

description: wife to King Henry, afterwards divorced

description: hostess of a tavern in Eastcheap
name: Hostess Quickly

description: duke of Anjou, and titular king of Naples

name: Richard III

son to the late Emperor of Rome, and afterwards
	declared Emperor
name: Saturninus
